repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project for Vietnam were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: the concept of quality of education is a dynamic
            concept that evolves over time. The evolution and
            development of education quality should be defined and
            formed to respond to a specific country or socio-economic
            and cultural context at a certain period of time. Therefore,
            setting up a Fundamental School Quality Level (FSQL) that
            matches the education system's implementation and
            financial capacity was critical to ensure its relevance and
            usefulness. The project was designed as a traditional
            investment project, providing incremental finance to a
            project with specific time-bound objectives that were
            expected to be achieved in targeted districts by completion.
            Its institutional arrangements were designed to facilitate
            and ensure the project's effective implementation, but
            institutional strengthening on a national scale over and
            above that which will be required for successful
            implementation was not an explicit objective of the Project
            (although there was an indicator that expected the MOET, and
            participating Departments of Education and Training (DoET)
            and Bureaus of Education and Training (BoET) to have
            regularly demonstrated strengthened capacity to identify,
            plan for, support and monitor the needs of educationally
            disadvantage children).

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Primary Education
            for Disadvantaged Children Project for Vietnam is to improve
            access to primary school and the quality of education for
            disadvantaged boys and girls. The reallocation of the credit
            proceeds will finance the costs associated with continuing
            activities currently financed by the Multi-Donor Trust Fund
            (MDTF) and enhance the impact of these well-performing
            components of the project. In particular, the International
            Development Association (IDA) funds will enable the
            continuing delivery of a package of support for primary
            education in order to ensure a Fundamental School Quality
            Level (FSQL) is reached at all main and satellite schools in
            226 districts in the Project's 40 target provinces.
            This extension of existing activities for a further year in
            the project districts can be expected to contribute to
            increasing primary education enrollment and completion and
            to improving learning achievement in disadvantaged
            communities, as well as for specific highly vulnerable
            groups such as children living with a disability. Further,
            the changes will allow full transfer of the project's
            innovative interventions into day-to-day Government
            processes and procedures, allow for nation-wide expansion
            and implementation, facilitate a smooth transition and
            ensure full sustainability in the long term.

repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Primary Education
            for Disadvantaged Children Project for Vietnam is to improve
            access to primary school and the quality of education for
            disadvantaged girls and boys. Disadvantaged children are
            broadly defined as school-aged children who are not enrolled
            or are at-risk of not completing their primary education;
            children who attend schools thatdo not meet fundamental
            quality standards; and disabled children or children from
            other highly vulnerable groups, such as street children,
            migrant children, or girls in certain ethnic minority areas.
            There are three project components beside the project
            management component. The first component raises all schools
            in the 189 most disadvantaged targeted districts to a
            fundamental school quality level (FSQL) through a
            two-pronged approach: 1) it provides necessary support to
            district administration to improve planning, management, and
            monitoring capabilities; and 2) it enhances school capacity
            to provide effective instruction at poorly resourced
            satellite campuses. Specifically, the component strengthens
            district school data collection systems; supports the
            development of a district-wide FSQL action plan; procures a
            teacher's guide, materials, and training modules;
            provides workshops; places teacher assistants; upgrades
            infrastructure; and strengthens parents' associations,
            among other activities. The second component prsents
            interventions that address the educational needs of disabled
            children; and addresses the educational needs of vulnerable
            groups, such as street and working children, children living
            in fishing communities, and others. The third component
            assists the Ministry of Education and Training (MoET) to lay
            down a pathway for reaching national school standards by
            using FSQL as a first step. It will propose FSQL criteria
            and raise awareness at all levels of the education system
            about how to bring every school up to FSQL levels.

Vietnam - Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project

repnme.cdata!:
Viet Nam - Primary Education for
            Disadvantaged Children Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) for
            the Primary Education for Disadvantaged Children Project
            identifies ethnic minority issues, summarized as
            difficulties in accessing education due to long distances,
            or late enrollments; persistent incomplete schooling due to
            high costs, or non-supportive environment to attend school,
            namely, sibling care in ethnic minority areas, or child
            labor demands; and, low performance quality resulting from
            non-supportive instructional environments, lack of
            instructional materials, and a highly condensed curriculum.
            Through project interventions, this IPP stipulates measures
            to involve ethnic minorities in attending schools, and
            participating in the educational achievements. Community
            mobilization will prod school attendance, and foster
            community training to improve school enrollment at the
            district level, by supporting the provision of free
            textbooks and supplies, supporting Vietnamese language
            readiness programs, and improving training of local
            teachers, in addition to quality improvements at satellite
            schools, which should result in enhanced educational quality
            between main campuses and satellite schools. Direct
            educational costs should be alleviated through fee waivers
            for books, and supplies, as well as community-supported
            language-readiness pre-schooling should ease the burden of
            sibling care, or child labor difficulties. Finally, the
            national curriculum standards should be evenly applied, but
            be relevant, and culturally appropriate to ethnic
            minorities, in accord with educational materials.

Viet Nam - Primary Education for
